body:
Parent: #89 (`lane:control-ui-settings`)

## Summary

`Ctrl+F` node search is useful but loses omnibar text focus after pressing Enter while iterating search results, forcing repeated re-clicks.

This makes result iteration feel broken even when search itself works.

## Likely hotspots

- `shell/desktop/ui/toolbar/toolbar_ui/toolbar_omnibar.rs`
- toolbar focus routing
- action dispatch path for search-mode Enter

## Scope

- Keep focus in the omnibar for Enter-based result iteration in search mode
- Preserve expected behavior differences between:
  - search iteration
  - navigation submit
  - explicit mode exits

## Done gate

- Enter-based result iteration keeps focus in omnibar in node-search mode.
- Navigation submit behavior remains intentional and documented.
- Add targeted tests for search mode vs navigation mode Enter handling.

labels.name: lane:control-ui-settings
labels.description: Command surface parity + settings IA convergence lane

labels.name: type:child
labels.description: Mergeable child slice under a hub issue

title: Control UI: omnibar node-search Enter action retains input focus for result iteration

body:
Parent: #89 (`lane:control-ui-settings`)
Related: settings surface scaffold work in `lane:viewer-platform` / `lane:control-ui-settings`

## Summary

Add a user-facing theme mode toggle in settings:
- `System`
- `Light`
- `Dark`

This is a straightforward settings IA improvement and a frequent UX need.

## Likely hotspots

- settings UI surface
- theme registry / theme application path
- persistence/preferences

## Scope

- Add setting field and UI control
- Persist across restart
- Apply at runtime
- Respect OS theme when `System` is selected (where supported)

## Done gate

- Theme mode can be changed in settings and persists across restart.
- `System` follows OS preference on supported platforms.
- Behavior is documented (including platform caveats if any).

labels.name: lane:control-ui-settings
labels.description: Command surface parity + settings IA convergence lane

title: Control UI / Settings: add theme mode toggle (System, Light, Dark)

body:
Parent: #89 (`lane:control-ui-settings`)
Related: #90 (`lane:embedder-debt`) for legacy webview context-menu paths

## Summary

Current command surfaces are fragmented:
- `F2` summons a menu labeled `Edge Commands`
- right-click often shows a short legacy context menu
- context availability is too hover-target-specific (node-biased)

We need one command-surface model that supports:
- a larger global palette variant (`F2`)
- a compact contextual variant (right-click near pointer)

## Desired behavior (from field report)

- `F2`: global command palette with broader scope
- right-click: compact contextual command palette
- both backed by the same registry-driven command model
- available across core contexts (canvas, nodes, edges, tiles, panes, and workbench chrome)

## Likely hotspots

- `render/command_palette.rs`
- `render/mod.rs`
- `input/mod.rs`
- action registry / runtime registries integration
- webview context menu bridge paths

## Scope

- Unify invocation model and dispatch path
- Retire or narrow `Edge Commands` naming
- Ensure context-sensitive enablement without hard-disappearing relevant categories unexpectedly

## Non-goals

- Full command taxonomy/pinning customization in first slice
- Every context category implemented at once

## Done gate

- One command-surface backend model supports both F2 and contextual invocation variants.
- Labeling no longer says `Edge Commands` unless truly edge-specific.
- Palette can be invoked from canvas, nodes, edges, panes, and workbench chrome with context-appropriate enablement.

labels.name: lane:control-ui-settings
labels.description: Command surface parity + settings IA convergence lane

labels.name: type:child
labels.description: Mergeable child slice under a hub issue

title: Control UI: unify F2 command palette and right-click context command surface across canvas/tiles/workbench

body:
Parent: #90 (`lane:embedder-debt`)
Related: #88 (`lane:stabilization`), #89 (`lane:control-ui-settings`)

## Summary

Right-click / ctrl-click link actions inside webpage content (e.g. `servo.org`) can invoke a short legacy context-menu/open-new-view path that appears to bypass Graphshell node/tile creation semantics.

Observed symptoms include:
- legacy/short context menu appears instead of Graphshell command surface
- a tile may open without a mapped graph node
- behavior makes split/frame/workbench testing harder due to inconsistent focus/path routing

## Why this belongs in embedder debt

This looks like a servoshell-era host/webview path still handling link/context actions outside the Graphshell command/tile model.

It is not just UI polish:
- it breaks graph authority
- it causes tile/node mapping ambiguity
- it creates focus/render behavior differences that are hard to test

## Likely hotspots

- `shell/desktop/ui/gui.rs`
- `shell/desktop/host/*`
- `shell/desktop/lifecycle/webview_controller.rs`
- `shell/desktop/workbench/tile_runtime.rs`
- webview context menu / open-new-view handlers

## Scope

- Trace web content context-menu and open-new-tile/split flows
- Identify where Graphshell node/tile semantics are bypassed
- Bridge or retire legacy path(s)
- Document deferred limitations if any path must remain temporarily

## Done gate

- Web content open-in-new-view flows route through Graphshell node/tile creation semantics.
- Legacy fallback context-menu path is removed, bridged into command surface, or explicitly constrained with documented limitations.
- Tile/node mapping invariants hold for these flows.

labels.name: lane:embedder-debt
labels.description: Servoshell inheritance retirement / host-UI boundary cleanup lane

labels.name: type:child
labels.description: Mergeable child slice under a hub issue

title: Embedder debt: web content new-tile/context-menu path bypasses Graphshell node/tile creation semantics

body:
Parent: #88 (`lane:stabilization`)
Related: #90 (`lane:embedder-debt`) for host/frame/focus ownership debt

## Summary

Newly opened tiles/panes sometimes do not render content immediately and can appear blank until extra clicks or tile switches.

Behavior varies with focus state:
- some panes appear after a click/switch
- some panes do not render on first click but appear on subsequent clicks
- deleting another focused pane can leave the graph pane unfocused in an empty-looking workbench region

## Repro (current field report)

- Open tiles/panes from node/link flows.
- Observe inconsistent focus on spawn.
- Observe blank viewport that appears later after focus changes.
- In pane deletion flows, observe graph pane not regaining focus/render as expected.

## Likely hotspots

- `shell/desktop/ui/gui.rs`
- `shell/desktop/ui/gui_frame.rs`
- `shell/desktop/workbench/*` focus/tile activation paths
- `shell/desktop/lifecycle/webview_controller.rs`
- `shell/desktop/workbench/tile_runtime.rs`

## Architectural context

This looks like focus ownership + render activation ordering debt, not only a local paint bug.
It likely overlaps servoshell-derived host/frame assumptions and should be cross-linked to `lane:embedder-debt`.

## Done gate

- New tiles/panes consistently render on first spawn when intended to be focused.
- Pane-deletion focus handoff is deterministic and renders immediately.
- Repro captured in a scenario test or diagnostics receipt.

labels.name: type:child
labels.description: Mergeable child slice under a hub issue

title: Stabilization: new tile/pane focus activation race leaves viewport blank until follow-up focus changes

body:
Parent: #88 (`lane:stabilization`)

## Summary

Graph canvas interaction is partially alive (`select node`, `lasso`), but camera/navigation controls fail broadly:
- `pan drag`
- `wheel zoom`
- `zoom in/out/reset`
- `zoom to fit`

This reproduces in the default graph pane (not only multi-pane scenarios).

## Repro (current field report)

- Run app on Windows 11.
- Open the default graph pane.
- Try drag-pan, wheel zoom, keyboard/command zoom actions, and zoom-to-fit.
- Result: some actions (`N` create node, `T` pause time) still work, but graph camera controls do not.

## Why this matters

This blocks normal graph interaction and makes it hard to validate other stabilization fixes.

## Likely hotspots

- `render/mod.rs`
- `app.rs`
- `input/mod.rs`
- `shell/desktop/ui/gui.rs`
- graph metadata/input ownership paths (`egui_graphs` integration)

## Notes / hypotheses

Recent fixes addressed:
- pending camera command targeting by `GraphViewId`
- lasso metadata ID keying drift
- one camera-control gate tied to radial menu state

Remaining failure likely sits in:
- input gating/consumption
- graph metadata availability at navigation handling time
- focus ownership / pane activation interactions

## Non-goals

- Lasso UX improvements (tracked separately)
- Command palette redesign

## Done gate

- Drag-pan, wheel zoom, zoom in/out/reset, and zoom-to-fit all work in the default graph pane.
- Behavior remains correct after opening/closing node panes and focus changes.
- Add targeted regression tests and a diagnostics receipt for camera command application + input path visibility.

labels.name: type:child
labels.description: Mergeable child slice under a hub issue

title: Stabilization: graph canvas pan/wheel zoom/zoom commands no-op across contexts

body:
Parent hub: #90
Source: design_docs/graphshell_docs/implementation_strategy/2026-02-26_composited_viewer_pass_contract.md (Appendix A.3)
Planning anchor: design_docs/graphshell_docs/implementation_strategy/PLANNING_REGISTER.md §0.10.3

## Scope
1. Add feature-gated diagnostics mode that injects bounded GL state perturbations between content and overlay passes.
2. Verify state restoration guarantees hold and record pass/fail in diagnostics channels.
3. Add focused tests for chaos-mode invariants (viewport/scissor/blend/active-texture/framebuffer).

## Foundation Done Gate
- Removes one concrete blocker for future capabilities (safe compositor extensibility) without introducing new cross-lane hotspot conflicts.
- Isolation contract is proven under adversarial state mutation, not only normal callback behavior.
- cargo check/test remain green.

## Scope
1. Add per-tile dirty-state contract for composited content pass execution.
2. Skip content callback for unchanged composited tiles while preserving overlay affordance pass.
3. Add diagnostics metric for frame skip rate and fallback reasons.
4. Add regression tests ensuring correctness when focus/hover changes on otherwise clean content.

## Foundation Done Gate
- Removes one concrete blocker for future capabilities (A.7 budgeting, A.6 transitions) without introducing new cross-lane hotspot conflicts.
- Demonstrable callback-skip behavior for unchanged tiles with no visual correctness regressions.
- cargo check/test remain green.

body:
Parent hub: #88
Source: design_docs/graphshell_docs/implementation_strategy/2026-02-26_composited_viewer_pass_contract.md (Appendix A.1)
Planning anchor: design_docs/graphshell_docs/implementation_strategy/PLANNING_REGISTER.md §0.10.3

## Scope
1. Extend compositor adapter diagnostics to capture per-frame callback GL state snapshots and ordering metadata.
2. Add bounded replay buffer (configurable) for recent compositor frames.
3. Emit structured replay artifacts on invariant failure (before/after deltas per callback).
4. Add inspector surfacing for replay availability and export path.

## Foundation Done Gate
- Removes one concrete blocker for future capabilities (A.3 chaos validation, A.9 telemetry debugging) without introducing new cross-lane hotspot conflicts.
- Repro steps for a GL-state regression can be replayed from captured traces.
- cargo check/test remain green.

body:
## Scope
1. Document canonical affordance policy table from Planning Register §0.3.4.
2. Implement per-render-mode affordance dispatch in tile compositor / tile render pass.
3. CompositedTexture: focus/hover rings draw in Pass 3 after content.
4. NativeOverlay: focus/hover rings draw in tile chrome border region.
5. EmbeddedEgui and Placeholder: standard egui widget-level strokes.
6. Add regression test covering focus ring visibility in at least CompositedTexture and Placeholder modes.

## Done gate
- Affordance rendering is render-mode-aware.
- NativeOverlay path has explicit documented limitation (chrome-region only).
- Spec/code parity claim for overlay z-order behavior is accurate.
- cargo check and cargo test pass.

## Hotspots
- shell/desktop/workbench/tile_compositor.rs
- shell/desktop/workbench/tile_render_pass.rs

## Links
- Parent lane hub: #99 (lane:spec-code-parity)
- Planning register section: design_docs/graphshell_docs/implementation_strategy/PLANNING_REGISTER.md §0.6

labels.name: lane:spec-code-parity

title: Define and implement overlay affordance policy per TileRenderMode

body:
## Scope
1. Create shell/desktop/workbench/compositor_adapter.rs module.
2. Implement CompositorAdapter wrapping ender_to_parent with GL state save/restore.
3. Decompose composite_active_node_pane_webviews into pass-model dispatch (Content Pass → Overlay Affordance Pass).
4. Move focus/hover ring rendering from Order::Middle co-layer to post-content Pass 3.
5. Add diagnostics spans for GL state save/restore and pass sequencing.
6. Add invariant test: overlay affordance callback executes after content callback for CompositedTexture tiles.

## Done gate
- Focus ring renders over composited web content during tile rearrange.
- CompositorAdapter GL state save/restore wrapper is tested with a mock callback.
- Diagnostics prove pass order (content before overlay) in compositor frame samples.
- cargo check and cargo test pass; no regressions in tile composition.

## Hotspots
- shell/desktop/workbench/tile_compositor.rs
- shell/desktop/workbench/compositor_adapter.rs (new)

## Links
- Parent lane hub: #88 (lane:stabilization)
- Planning register section: design_docs/graphshell_docs/implementation_strategy/PLANNING_REGISTER.md §0.6
title: Introduce Surface Composition Pass Model and CompositorAdapter for GL state isolation

Why now
- "Unresponsive controls" reports likely involve event-consumption/focus ownership interactions between graph and node-pane paths.

Scope

- Produce a short receipt or diagnostics evidence even if no code changes are needed initially.

Hotspots
- `shell/desktop/ui/gui.rs`
- `input/mod.rs`

Done gate
- Root cause(s) documented and tracked; targeted fix issue(s) opened or landed.

body:
Parent hub: #88

Why now
- Lasso/selection behavior can break in multi-view because metadata lookup still uses a hardcoded pre-split ID.

Scope
- Replace hardcoded metadata ID usage with per-view metadata keying.
- Add regression coverage for non-default graph views.

Hotspots
- `render/mod.rs`

Done gate
- Lasso selection works in multiple graph panes and passes targeted tests.

body:
Parent hub: #88

Why now
- Multi-graph-pane support exists, but camera command routing still uses a global pending command path that can mis-target views.

Scope
- Introduce per-view camera command targeting (or equivalent routing) keyed by `GraphViewId`.
- Ensure zoom-to-fit and related camera actions apply to the intended focused graph pane.

Hotspots
- `app.rs`
- `render/mod.rs`

Done gate
- Camera commands are routed to the intended graph view with regression coverage for split-pane scenarios.

labels.name: type:child
labels.description: Mergeable child slice under a hub issue

title: Stabilization: camera commands target global pending state in multi-view (add per-GraphViewId routing)

body:

- The focus affordance is visually hidden behind document/web content during tile rearrange, making pane reconfiguration feel broken.

Scope
- Fix compositor z-order for Servo/texture-backed document view focus affordance.
- Define and document Wry/overlay fallback affordance (no fake parity if OS overlay is above egui).

Hotspots
- `shell/desktop/workbench/tile_compositor.rs`

Done gate
- Focus affordance is visible during rearrange on Servo-backed document tiles.
- Wry behavior is explicit (implemented fallback or documented limitation).

body:
Source backlog entry: $id

- **Type**: Concept adoption / Future architecture
- **GitHub Issue Title**: `Future architecture: adopt 2D↔3D hotswitch as tracked graph-view capability`
- **GitHub Labels**: `concept/adoption`, `3d`, `graph-ui`, `architecture`, `future-roadmap`
- **GitHub Milestone**: `Concept Adoption / 3D`
- **GitHub Issue Status**: `Deferred (blocked)`
- **Blocking Prerequisites**:
  - `P5` pane-hosted view foundation complete
  - `P6` graph multi-view state (`GraphViewState`) stabilized
- **Goal**: Add `ViewDimension` / position-parity hotswitch to medium-term roadmap tied to graph-pane architecture.
- **Scope**:
  - Define where `ViewDimension` lives and how snapshots degrade gracefully.
  - Link to graph-pane payload model.
- **Dependencies**: Pane-hosted multi-view + `GraphViewState` stabilization.
- **Acceptance**:
  - 3D hotswitch appears as a roadmap milestone or dedicated implementation strategy.
- **Definition of Done**:
  - `ViewDimension` ownership and snapshot fallback/degradation rules are tracked in a current plan.
- **Review Check (comprehension)**:
  - 3D hotswitch belongs to graph-view state, so it depends on graph multi-view architecture maturity.
- **Source refs**:
  - `design_docs/graphshell_docs/implementation_strategy/2026-02-24_physics_engine_extensibility_plan.md`
  - `design_docs/graphshell_docs/implementation_strategy/2026-02-24_immediate_priorities.md:70`
title: Future architecture: adopt 2D↔3D hotswitch as tracked graph-view capability
